title: Ticket #4997: Infinite loop in condor_ssh_to_job
description:
CMS operations reported the following: 

Hi All,

I was collecting information about ~2weeks ago about condor_ssh_to_job to each site. Seems whenever
condor_ssh_to_job fails due to site blocking (/sbin/nologin, sshd blocking, internal ACL or putting sshd in
/etc/hosts.deny with line sshd: ALL) process stays running on our machine and consuming CPU [1]. After killing
[2] all condor_ssh_to_job pids, cpu usage decreased from 40% to %3. How to reproduce [3].

Cheers,
Justas

[1] Please see a drop of User cpu when I killed all condor_ssh_to_job pids
http://hcc-ganglia.unl.edu/graph_all_periods.php?h=vocms095.cern.ch&m=load_report&r=hour&s=by%20name&hc=4&mc=2&st=1427093165&g=cpu_report&z=large&c=crab-infrastructure

[2]
[root@vocms095 ~]# echo $(ps aux | grep 'condor_ssh_to_job' | awk '{print $2}')
859634 859641 859651 859657 859663 859669 859679 860201 863703 863720 863975 864017 865298 865369 865379 1314386
1314464 1314518 1314557 1315457 1316103 3489257 3489817 3490141 3490816 3592473 3869784
[root@vocms095 ~]# kill $(ps aux | grep 'condor_ssh_to_job' | awk '{print $2}')

[3]
[root@vocms095 ~]# ps aux | grep condor_ssh_to_job
root     3885791  0.0  0.0  10504   724 pts/5    S+   08:00   0:00 grep condor_ssh_to_job
[root@vocms095 ~]# condor_q -const 'MATCH_GLIDEIN_CMSSite=?="T2_US_Wisconsin"'
#Select any running job ID (T2_US_Wisconsin is one of the sites which does not allow ssh connection)
[root@vocms095 ~]# condor_ssh_to_job 2371542.0
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
[root@vocms095 ~]# ps aux | grep condor_ssh_to_job
root     3886657 84.3  0.0  43544  4208 pts/5    R    08:02   0:27 condor_ssh_to_job -proxy
/tmp/root.condor_ssh_to_job_52598b59/fdpass
root     3887028  0.0  0.0  10508   760 pts/5    S+   08:02   0:00 grep condor_ssh_to_job

#condor_ssh_to_job process will stay all the time

Poking around, I found a live specimen and got a stack trace: 

(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007f263558d098 in poll () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007f2636e1498b in Selector::execute() () from /usr/lib64/condor/libcondor_utils_8_3_2.so
#2  0x00007f2636e55a0c in SocketProxy::execute() () from /usr/lib64/condor/libcondor_utils_8_3_2.so
#3  0x00000000004044c0 in SSHToJob::execute_proxy() ()
#4  0x000000000040672a in main ()

Strace just has this repeating: 

poll([{fd=0, events=POLLIN}], 1, -1)    = 1 ([{fd=0, revents=POLLHUP}])

I think the single-shot mode of the selector is improperly ignoring POLLHUP, causing a logic issue in the SocketProxy class.
